name: outrigger
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a part fixed parallel to a small boat or canoe (= a light, narrow boat with pointed ends) to help stop it from capsizing (= turning upside down or onto its side by accident): The vessel has a narrow hull and large outriggers giving the appearance of a three-hulled craft. Local boys with outrigger boats are on hand to transport surfers out beyond the reefs.
a boat that has an outrigger to help stop it from capsizing (= turning upside down or onto its side by accident): They returned in their outrigger at night to find no welcoming lights. Then two outriggers flashed by.
a long part that sticks out from the side of a rowing boat and holds the supports for the oars (= long poles used for rowing): Outriggers make the oars more effective in propelling the boat forward. Outriggers project from the boat and provide greater leverage.
